= Success
| Fail
| Pending String

name :: String
requirement :: String

}

Documentation
data Result
The result of running a test.
Constructors
Success
Fail
Pending String
Instances
Eq Result
SpecResult Result
data Spec
Everything needed to specify and test a specific behavior.
Constructors
Spec
name :: StringWhat is being tested, usually the name of a type.
requirement :: StringThe specific requirement being tested.
result :: ResultThe status of this requirement.
describe
:: StringThe name of what is being described, usually a function or type.
-> [IO (String, Result)]A list of requirements and validations, created by a list of it.
-> IO [Spec]Specs

Create a set of specifications for a specific type being described. Once you know what you want specs for, use this. 

 describe "abs" [
   it "returns a positive number given a negative number"
     (abs (-1) == 1)
   ]
class SpecResult a where
Anything that can be used as validation that a spec is met.
Methods
it
:: StringA description of this spec.
-> aA validator for this spec.
-> IO (String, Result)The combined description and result of validation.

Create a description and validation of a spec, a list of these is used by describe. Once you know what you want to specify, use this. 

 describe "closeEnough" [
   it "is true if two numbers are almost the same"
     (1.001 `closeEnough` 1.002),

   it "is false if two numbers are not almost the same"
     (not $ 1.001 `closeEnough` 1.003),

   it "can also detect infinite loops"
     (pending "still figuring this one out")
   ]
Instances
SpecResult Bool
SpecResult Result
Testable t => SpecResult (QuickCheckProperty t)
pending
:: StringAn explination for why this spec is pending.
-> Result

Declare a spec as not successful or failing but pending some other work. If you want to track a specification but don't expect it to succeed or fail yet, use this. 

 describe "fancyFormatter" [
   it "can format text in a way that everyone likes"
     (pending "waiting for clarification from the designers")
   ]
documentSpecs :: [Spec] -> [String]
Create a document of the given specs.
documentGroup :: [Spec] -> [String]
Create a document of the given group of specs.
documentSpec :: Spec -> String
Create a document of the given spec.
timingSummary :: Double -> String
Create a summary of how long it took to validate the specs.
successSummary :: [Spec] -> String
Create a sumary of how many specs exist and how many failed validation.
hspec
:: [Spec]The specs you are interested in.
-> [String]A human-readable summary of the specs and which are successfully implemented.
Create a document of the given specs. This does not track how much time it took to validate the specs. If you want a description of each spec and don't need to know how long it tacks to check, use this.
hHspec
:: HandleA handle for the stream you want to write to, usually stdout.
-> IO [Spec]The specs you are interested in.
-> IO ()

Create a document of the given specs and write it to the given handle. This does track how much time it took to validate the specs. If you want a description of each spec and do need to know how long it tacks to check or want to write to a handle, use this. 

 writeReport filename specs = withFile filename WriteMode (\ h -> hHspec h specs)
quantify :: Num a => a -> String -> String
Create a more readable display of a quantity of something.
